fields.physical_description:
The carving shows a man and woman entwined and sitting on a bench. It is simply carved and partly painted in ochre and orange; together with red and blue-black designs representing single flowers on the woman's dress and a blue `necklace'. The facial features are indicated by two pink cheek dots; black dot eyes and a red mouth. The figures and bench are one unit and pegged into a roughly carved base. The figures only are varnished. 
*This is both a toy and a symbol; the theme is expressed in other mediums such as the papier maché. The symbolic message is probbly representing happiness and good marriage. 
A N Varganov is a well known and internationally known maker of these toys. His work is represented in other museums in the USA; Australia; Japan and Germany. He comes from a traditional craft family making
these types of toys; both wooden and papier maché; from before 1900.
fields.title: LOVERS
fields.materials_techniques: hand carved limewood; partly painted and varnished
fields.marks: AB incised; written in pencil in Russian lettering BUODIEUKH and the date 21.VII.91
fields.history_note:
References: RUSSIAN FOLK TOYS booklet published by the Museum of Toys; USSR Academy of Pedagogical Sciences. see also registered packet

Collection was presented to BGM by the Traditional Sergiev Cultures Centre; following an exhibition at the Cambridge Folk Museum;
September 1994. The items are modern; made to the traditional designs and methods by craftsmen whose families had produced the toys before 1900.

Price: £12.00
fields.production_note:
Made by: A N Varganov of Sergiev Posad.
Russia
